+def test_matmul_ptx():
+    import fnmatch
+
+    from triton.runtime.cache import cache_dir
+
+    def files_are_equal(file1, file2):
+        with open(file1, 'rb') as f1, open(file2, 'rb') as f2:
+            return f1.read() == f2.read()
+
+    def assert_ptxes_with_hash_are_equal(hash):
+        cache_path = os.path.join(cache_dir(), hash)
+        ref_cache_path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(__file__)), "cache_reference", hash)
+        assert os.path.exists(cache_path), f"PTX path {cache_path} not found"
+        ptx_files = [f for f in os.listdir(cache_path) if fnmatch.fnmatch(f, "*.ptx")]
+        assert len(ptx_files) == 1, "Expecting exactly one PTX file"
+
+        ptx = os.path.join(cache_path, ptx_files[0])
+        ptx_ref = os.path.join(ref_cache_path, "_kernel.ptx")
+        assert os.path.exists(ptx_ref), f"PTX reference path {ptx_ref} not found"
+        assert files_are_equal(ptx, ptx_ref), "PTX files are not equal"
+
+    capability = torch.cuda.get_device_capability()
+    if capability[0] < 7:
+        pytest.skip("Only test tl.dot() on devices with sm >= 70")
+    torch.manual_seed(0)
+    BLOCK_M, BLOCK_N, BLOCK_K = 128, 256, 64
+    # nuke kernel decorators -- will set meta-parameters manually
+    kwargs = {'BLOCK_M': BLOCK_M, 'BLOCK_N': BLOCK_N, 'BLOCK_K': BLOCK_K, 'SPLIT_K': 1}
+    configs = [triton.Config(kwargs=kwargs, num_warps=8, num_stages=3, pre_hook=None)]
+    kernel = triton.ops._matmul.kernel
+    kernel.configs = configs
+
+    M, N, K = BLOCK_M, BLOCK_N, BLOCK_K
+    dtype, device = torch.float16, "cuda"
+    # allocate inputs
+    a = .1 * torch.randn((M, K), device=device, dtype=dtype)
+    b = .1 * torch.randn((K, N), device=device, dtype=dtype)
+    # run test
+    c_ref = torch.matmul(a, b)
+    c_tri = triton.ops.matmul(a, b)
+
+    np.testing.assert_allclose(c_ref.cpu().numpy(), c_tri.cpu().numpy(), rtol=0.01, atol=1e-3)
+
+    # Note: if hash changes, it means that the kernel or its args has been modified,
+    # we need to update the hash manually and check that the PTX file is still the same
+    hash = "5c1b57bd91feef763f66c5fdc6c3669f"
+    assert_ptxes_with_hash_are_equal(hash)
+
+
 @pytest.mark.parametrize("dtype_str", int_dtypes + float_dtypes + ['bfloat16'])

     dtype = getattr(torch, dtype_str)
